data.name: Metapod
data.flavorText: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Breloom
data.flavorText: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.

attacks.name: Impact Blow
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Impact Blow.

data.name: Sewaddle
data.flavorText: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

attacks.name: Grass Munch
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Grubbin
data.flavorText: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Rillaboom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Drain Punch
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Appletun V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sweet Impact
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.

attacks.name: Warm Up
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

attacks.name: Fling Fire
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Cinderace V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: All-Out Shot
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Cinderace VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Fireball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Sizzlipede
data.flavorText: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they're well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Totodile
data.flavorText: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its Trainer must be careful.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Splash Arch
attacks.text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its amazing regenerative powers return it to its previous state in half a day!

attacks.name: Soak in Water
attacks.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon.

data.name: Caterpie
data.flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: Flock
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Caterpie and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Shroomish
data.flavorText: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.

data.name: Breloom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.

data.name: Pansage
data.flavorText: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

data.name: Simisage
data.flavorText: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Leavanny
data.flavorText: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

attacks.name: Healing Circle
attacks.text: Heal all damage from each of your Benched Pokémon. If you healed any damage in this way, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.name: Virizion
data.flavorText: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

attacks.name: Bail Out
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Araquanid
data.flavorText: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.

attacks.name: Bubble Launch
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Gossifleur
data.flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

data.name: Rillaboom VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Drum Solo
attacks.text: This attack also does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

data.name: Magcargo
data.flavorText: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

attacks.name: Body Splash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each tails, discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Chandelure VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cursed Shimmer
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Max Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 70 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

attacks.name: Fiery Cheering
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Heatmor
data.flavorText: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Exciting Flame
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Energy attached (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack also does 180 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Centiskorch
data.flavorText: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

attacks.name: Coil
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 90 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: It rotates its geometrically shaped body to swim through the water. It always seems to be sending out mysterious radio waves.

attacks.name: Multishot Star
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Water Energy from this Pokémon. Then, for each Energy card you discarded in this way, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and do 30 damage to it. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Croconaw
data.flavorText: Once it bites down, it won't let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.

data.name: Feraligatr
data.flavorText: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

abilities.name: Rowdy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you must flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Butterfree
data.flavorText: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

abilities.name: Tricolored Scales
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

data.name: Swadloon
data.flavorText: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Shelmet
data.flavorText: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.

data.name: Phantump
data.flavorText: With a voice like a human child's, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

data.name: Accelgor
data.flavorText: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.

attacks.name: Ninja Tornado
attacks.text: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack can be used for Grass.

data.name: Dewpider
data.flavorText: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

data.name: Tsareena V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Queen's Orders
attacks.text: You may discard any number of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discarded in this way.

data.name: Zarude
data.flavorText: Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.

attacks.name: Wild Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

data.name: Cinderace V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Maractus
data.flavorText: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They're jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

attacks.name: Ditch and Shake
attacks.text: Discard any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Trevenant
data.flavorText: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon's feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

data.name: Eldegoss
data.flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

attacks.name: Sunny Wind
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

abilities.name: Byway of the Nine-Tailed Fox
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each of your Pokémon that has any Fire Energy attached is ColorlessColorless less.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

data.name: Arcanine
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Oricorio
data.flavorText: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

abilities.name: Lesson in Zeal
abilities.text: All of your Fusion Strike Pokémon take 20 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Lesson in Zeal Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Glistening Droplets
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Chandelure V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 40 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

data.name: Centiskorch
data.flavorText: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

data.name: Sizzlipede
data.flavorText: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they're well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

data.name: Cloyster
data.flavorText: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Split
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Marill
data.flavorText: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That's why this Pokémon is never cold.

attacks.name: Aqua Liner
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Let's All Rollout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Let's All Rollout attack.

data.name: Mantine
data.flavorText: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Greninja V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dancing Shuriken
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

data.name: Heliolisk
data.flavorText: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Eelektross
data.flavorText: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

attacks.name: Upper Shock
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Eelektrik during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Zeraora
data.flavorText: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Toxtricity
data.flavorText: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.

attacks.name: Punk Shock
attacks.text: You may choose to make your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed. If you do, this Pokémon also does 70 damage to itself.

data.name: Mawile
data.flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp Hold
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.name: Deoxys
data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Photon Boost
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fusion Strike Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Palossand
data.flavorText: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.

attacks.name: Oppressing Sandstorm
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it is Knocked Out.

data.name: Dreepy
data.flavorText: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

attacks.name: Infestation
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Sandshrew
data.flavorText: When its skin gets wrinkled from moisture, it heads for a volcano. It lies flat on a spot with a lot of geothermal heat and dries itself out.

attacks.name: Dig It Up
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your deck. You may discard that card.

attacks.name: Let's All Rollout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Let's All Rollout attack.

data.name: Hariyama
data.flavorText: Hariyama that are big and fat aren't necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

data.name: Falinks
data.flavorText: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

attacks.name: Cliff Edge Formation
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 160 more damage.

data.name: Falinks
data.flavorText: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

data.name: Gengar V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Slumber
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pain Explosion
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Linoone
data.flavorText: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.

data.name: Galarian Obstagoon
data.flavorText: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

attacks.name: Silence
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

attacks.name: Merciless Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Trubbish
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Grimmsnarl
data.flavorText: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.

attacks.name: Rear Attack
attacks.text: If you have 2 or fewer Benched Pokémon, this attack does 140 more damage.

data.name: Skarmory
data.flavorText: Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy, but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles an hour!

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Copperajah
data.flavorText: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.

attacks.name: High Horsepower
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: Because the eggs on their bellies have been overharvested by people in the past, the Chansey population remains very small.

attacks.name: Drain Slap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Kangaskhan
data.flavorText: You shouldn't get close to the child when it's playing outside its mother's pouch. Its mother is always nearby watching over it.

attacks.name: Coordinated One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Stantler
data.flavorText: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.

attacks.name: Wild Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Diggersby
data.flavorText: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Cook
rules: Heal 70 damage from your Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Dancer
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you go second and it's your first turn, draw 3 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Power Tablet
rules: During this turn, your Fusion Strike Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Sidney
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards, Special Energy cards, and Stadium cards from it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Celebi V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Leaflet Dance
attacks.text: Attach any number of Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Slash Back
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hoopa V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Two-Faced
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Darkness type.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Greedent V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nom-Nom-Nom Incisors
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

data.name: Gengar VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fear and Panic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX in play.

attacks.name: G-Max Swallow Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Shauna
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Mew VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross Fusion Strike
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Benched Fusion Strike Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Max Miracle
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Schoolboy
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent has exactly 1, 3, or 5 Prize cards remaining, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Clamperl
data.flavorText: Clamperl's pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder's pearls.

data.name: Huntail
data.flavorText: Deep seas are their habitat. According to tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore, something unfortunate will happen.

abilities.name: Single Strike Jammer
abilities.text: Your opponent's Single Strike Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more.

data.name: Galarian Darumaka
data.flavorText: The colder they get, the more energetic they are. They freeze their breath to make snowballs, using them as ammo for playful snowball fights.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Clauncher
data.flavorText: It moves around by jetting water from its right pincer. It has a poor sense of balance, so it's terrible at swimming straight.

data.name: Galarian Darmanitan
data.flavorText: Though it has a gentle disposition, it's also very strong. It will quickly freeze the snowball on its head before going for a headbutt.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Daruma Headbutt
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack can be used for Water.

data.name: Inteleon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pyukumuku
data.flavorText: It's covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

abilities.name: Pitch a Pyukumuku
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in your hand, you may reveal it and put it on the bottom of your deck. If you do, draw a card. You can't use more than 1 Pitch a Pyukumuku Ability each turn.

data.name: Arrokuda
data.flavorText: After it's eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That's when Cramorant swallows it up.

data.name: Plusle
data.flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

attacks.name: Spark Duo
attacks.text: If 1 of your Minun used an attack during your last turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.

attacks.name: Sonic Boom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 90 damage to itself.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.

attacks.name: Surprise Short
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tools from all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Vikavolt
data.flavorText: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.

attacks.name: Electro Blaster
attacks.text: Discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 200 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Boltund VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bolt Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Max Bolt.

data.name: Toxtricity
data.flavorText: It has an electrical organ on its chest. While generating electricity, it fills its surroundings with sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.

abilities.name: Maximum Downer
abilities.text: If all your Pokémon in play are Fusion Strike Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon VMAX in play get -30 HP.

data.name: Mew V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Mix
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Fusion Strike Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Leap
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.flavorText: The songs they sing are totally different depending on the region they live in. Some even sound like they're shouting!

attacks.name: Let's All Rollout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Let's All Rollout attack.

data.name: Jynx
data.flavorText: Its strange cries sound like human language. There are some musicians who compose songs for Jynx to sing.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Snubbull
data.flavorText: In contrast to its appearance, it's quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

data.name: Galarian Corsola
data.flavorText: Sudden climate change wiped out this ancient kind of Corsola. This Pokémon absorbs others' life-force through its branches.

data.name: Musharna
data.flavorText: It drowses and dreams all the time. It's best to leave it be if it's just woken up, as it's a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Sigilyph
data.flavorText: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Drakloak
data.flavorText: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it'll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Sandslash
data.flavorText: Thanks to its thick claws, it's good at climbing trees. There are plenty of Sandslash that park themselves in trees and go right to sleep.

attacks.name: Dig Uppercut
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: It uses both hands to climb precipitous cliffs. People who see it in action have been known to take up bouldering.

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: It's a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

data.name: Lucario V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Pancham
data.flavorText: Wanting to make sure it's taken seriously, Pancham's always giving others a glare. But if it's not focusing, it ends up smiling.

attacks.name: Raised Bad
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Darkness Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Grapploct
data.flavorText: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

data.name: Tyranitar V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Galarian Zigzagoon
data.flavorText: Thought to be the oldest form of Zigzagoon, it moves in zigzags and wreaks havoc upon its surroundings.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Croagunk
data.flavorText: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.

data.name: Toxicroak
data.flavorText: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and Seismitoad are related species.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During Pokémon Checkup, put 4 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.

data.name: Vullaby
data.flavorText: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Impidimp
data.flavorText: It sneaks into people's homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Genesect V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fusion Strike System
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have as many cards in your hand as you have Fusion Strike Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Techno Blast
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Latias
data.flavorText: It can telepathically communicate with people. It changes its appearance using its down that refracts light.

abilities.name: Red Assist
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Latios.

attacks.name: Dyna Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon VMAX.

data.name: Latios
data.flavorText: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that dislikes fighting.

abilities.name: Blue Assist
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Latias.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Blissey
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is overflowing with love. Only Chansey that share a strong bond with their Trainer can evolve, so people say.

abilities.name: Expert in Roundness
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to each of your Pokémon that has the Let's All Rollout attack by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon VMAX.

attacks.name: Let's All Rollout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Let's All Rollout attack.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

data.name: Delcatty
data.flavorText: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

attacks.name: Willful Busybody
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.name: Buneary
data.flavorText: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it's attacked by an enemy.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Hawlucha
data.flavorText: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.

attacks.name: Flying Stomp
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Greedent VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.text: If your opponent's Basic Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 2 more Prize cards.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Wooloo
data.flavorText: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won't be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Let's All Rollout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Let's All Rollout attack.

data.name: Dubwool
data.flavorText: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

data.name: Azumarill
data.flavorText: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

attacks.name: Dive and Rescue
attacks.text: Put up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and Supporter cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Qwilfish
data.flavorText: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Swampert
data.flavorText: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

abilities.name: Muddy Maker
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card or a Fighting Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Simipour
data.flavorText: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Circus Soaking
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 60 damage for each Supporter card you find there.

data.name: Basculin
data.flavorText: Known for their violence, these Pokémon have the most fights with schools of red-striped Basculin.

attacks.name: Swarm the Wound
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

attacks.name: Pry
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

data.name: Crabominable V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Trigger Avalanche
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Destroyer Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Inteleon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Double Gunner
abilities.text: You must discard a Water Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and put 2 damage counters on each of them.

attacks.name: G-Max Spiral
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Barraskewda
data.flavorText: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.

data.name: Pikachu V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Minun
data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Helioptile
data.flavorText: The sun powers this Pokémon's electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they're precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

attacks.name: Targeted Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mew VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross Fusion Strike
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Benched Fusion Strike Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Max Miracle
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Granbull
data.flavorText: Although it's popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it's totally incompetent as a watchdog.

abilities.name: Dig Up
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Sandygast
data.flavorText: If you build sand mounds when you're playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.

data.name: Dragapult
data.flavorText: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult's horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.

attacks.name: Fusion Strike Assault
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Fusion Strike Pokémon in play.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: If one gets angry, all the others around it will get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop of Mankey.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy despite its constant raging.

attacks.name: Gut Punch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Golem
data.flavorText: It detonates its own body. The power from that explosion can propel it up steep mountain paths with amazing speed.

abilities.name: Desperate Blast
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

attacks.name: Powerful Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Graveler
data.flavorText: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.

data.name: Gliscor
data.flavorText: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Venomous Hit
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

data.name: Landorus
data.flavorText: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthen Boom
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Garbodor
data.flavorText: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Zoroark
data.flavorText: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.

attacks.name: Double Claw
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Morgrem
data.flavorText: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

attacks.name: Explosive Discontent
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Togedemaru
data.flavorText: When it's in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

attacks.name: Let's All Rollout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Let's All Rollout attack.

data.name: Klefki
data.flavorText: Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki began appearing in human settlements.

attacks.name: Unlock
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Melmetal
data.flavorText: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.

attacks.name: Ingot Swing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon that have an Ability.

attacks.name: Blasting Hammer
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Meltan
data.flavorText: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

attacks.name: Iron Intake
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Goomy
data.flavorText: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they've survived.

data.name: Goodra
data.flavorText: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.

abilities.name: Slimy Room
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent tries to attach an Energy card from their hand to a Pokémon, they must flip a coin. If tails, your opponent discards that Energy card instead of attaching it, and this doesn't use up their Energy attachment for the turn.

data.name: Sliggoo
data.flavorText: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Turtonator
data.flavorText: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

attacks.name: Shell Trap
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn't get along with Galarian Meowth.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Continuous Steps
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Lopunny
data.flavorText: It's notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: It's very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight's flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won't be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fusion Strike System
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have as many cards in your hand as you have Fusion Strike Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Techno Blast
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Inteleon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Double Gunner
abilities.text: You must discard a Water Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and put 2 damage counters on each of them.

attacks.name: G-Max Spiral
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. If you do, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Mudkip
data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Marshtomp
data.flavorText: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Gorebyss
data.flavorText: It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it becomes food for other Pokémon.

abilities.name: Rapid Strike Canceler
abilities.text: Your opponent's Rapid Strike Pokémon in play have no Abilities.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Clawitzer
data.flavorText: Its right arm is packed with meat. When its pincer falls off, it's exported to be used as a cooking ingredient.

attacks.name: Snipe Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Chewtle
data.flavorText: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

data.name: Drednaw
data.flavorText: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

attacks.name: Hard Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Snom
data.flavorText: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.

attacks.name: Find Ice
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Frosmoth
data.flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Blizzard Loop
attacks.text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

attacks.name: Single Shot Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

data.name: Charjabug
data.flavorText: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

data.name: Boltund V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.flavorText: When it gets angry, it inhales with all its might, and its body gradually inflates. Sometimes they can grow 20 times larger!

attacks.name: Find Treasure
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Galarian Cursola
data.flavorText: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You'll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

attacks.name: Force Regeneration
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon V from your opponent's discard pile onto their Bench. If you do, put damage counters on that Pokémon until its remaining HP is 30.

data.name: Munna
data.flavorText: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it's eating a good dream, and black when it's eating a nightmare.

data.name: Meloetta
data.flavorText: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

attacks.name: Melodious Echo
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each Fusion Strike Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Indeedee
data.flavorText: They diligently serve people and Pokémon so they can gather feelings of gratitude. The females are particularly good at babysitting.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Makuhita
data.flavorText: There's a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.

data.name: Gligar
data.flavorText: It flies straight at its target's face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Stufful
data.flavorText: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

data.name: Claydol
data.flavorText: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ancient Imprint
attacks.text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 60.

data.name: Bewear
data.flavorText: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn't alarmed when that happens—it knows they'll grow back. It's about as smart as a three-year-old.

data.name: Gengar VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fear and Panic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX in play.

attacks.name: G-Max Swallow Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily chomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with Basculin over food.

data.name: Sharpedo
data.flavorText: It drinks in seawater and jets it from its rear to propel itself. It's very sensitive to the scent of blood.

data.name: Absol
data.flavorText: The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and detest it, but interest in its power to predict disasters is on the rise.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

data.name: Darkrai
data.flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

data.name: Mandibuzz
data.flavorText: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.

attacks.name: Bone Block
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Pokémon can't be played from your opponent's hand to evolve the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Pangoro
data.flavorText: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

attacks.name: Knocking Hammer
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Shakedown
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Galarian Meowth
data.flavorText: These daring Pokémon have coins on their foreheads. Darker coins are harder, and harder coins garner more respect among Meowth.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Yveltal
data.flavorText: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

attacks.name: Adversity Jaws
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fire Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker
data.flavorText: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

attacks.name: Call to Muster
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

attacks.name: Rock Tomb
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Corviknight
data.flavorText: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region's airborne taxi service.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Cyclone
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Cufant
data.flavorText: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.

attacks.name: High Horsepower
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Persian
data.flavorText: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Dodrio V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: No Reprieve
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 80 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rampage Drill
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Dunsparce
data.flavorText: When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail to make its escape. If you happen to find one, consider yourself lucky.

abilities.name: Mysterious Nest
abilities.text: Colorless Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Weakness.

data.name: Skitty
data.flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Smeargle
data.flavorText: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

attacks.name: Sketching Trash
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Fusion Strike Trainer cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Corvisquire
data.flavorText: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent's strength.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Rookidee
data.flavorText: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Bug Catcher
rules: Draw 2 cards. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Cram-o-matic
rules: You can use this card only if you discard another Item card from your hand. Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Farewell Bell
rules: If the Pokémon VMAX this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

data.name: Judge
rules: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Quick Ball
rules: You can play this card only if you discard another card from your hand. Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Schoolboy
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent has exactly 1, 3, or 5 Prize cards remaining, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Chandelure V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 40 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

data.name: Mew V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Mix
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Fusion Strike Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Leap
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.name: Sidney
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards, Special Energy cards, and Stadium cards from it.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Training Court
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put a basic Energy card from their discard pile into their hand.

data.name: Chili & Cilan & Cress
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Fusion Strike Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Elesa's Sparkle
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Fusion Strike Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Fusion Strike Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Boltund VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bolt Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Max Bolt.

data.name: Schoolgirl
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent has exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Chandelure VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Cursed Shimmer
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Max Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 70 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

data.name: Schoolboy
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent has exactly 1, 3, or 5 Prize cards remaining, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Espeon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solar Revelation
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks from your opponent's Pokémon done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached.(Existing effects are not removed. Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Max Mindstorm
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Dancer
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you go second and it's your first turn, draw 3 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

abilities.name: Dynamotor
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
